Detailed Description

This class is a Pin for connecting Blocks together. Two Pins must be connected using a Wire. A Pin must know the amount of data that wishes to manage. When you create a Pin, you must specify the preferred size and count of buffers this pin wants to use. Each Pin contains a buffer pool on which it can only do read operations (methods: use() and freeBuffer()). For write operations you need to get the connected Peer for this pin and then get its buffer pool (methods: getBuffer()).

anonymous enum
 

Pin status values.

Enumeration values:
UNCONNECTED  the pin is not connected
CONNECTED  the pin is connected

anonymous enum
 

Pin direction.

Enumeration values:
DIR_INPUT  the pin is for input
DIR_OUTPUT  the pin is for output
DIR_IO  the pin is for input/output

Definition at line 66 of file pin.hpp.

anonymous enum
 

Constants to use in lock/unlock.

Enumeration values:
PEERS_TABLE  lock/unlock the peers table
WIRES_TABLE  lock/unlock the wires table
ALL_TABLES  lock/unlock all tables

DataBuf* uStreamLib::Pin::getInputBuffer (  uint32  bid  )  [inline]
 

Get the specified input buffer. This method returns a databuf whose bid is specified as parameter. The returned databuf is ready for reading and has certainly been sent by the peer data pin.

Parameters:
bid the buffer identifier of the requested buffer.
Returns:
the requested databuf or NULL if databuf cannot be returned.
